name: concrete production, 50MPa, with cement, Portland | concrete, 50MPa | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26047/documentation

This dataset represents the production of North American 50 MPa ready-mix concrete. Density: 2"332 kg/m³. Ingredients (for 1 m³): Cement 344 kg, Water 155 kg, Gravel 950 kg, Sand 798 kg, Fly ash, Silica fume or Blast furnace slag 81.85 kg, Admixtures (air-entrainers, water reducing admixture and superplastisizers) 3,75 kg. 50 MPa concrete is intended for structurally reinforced specialty usage, exposed to chlorides and other severe environments, with or without freezing and thawing conditions, and with high durability performances expectations (e.g. work of art etc.) (following the Canadian CSA specs - http://www.rmcao.org/sites/default/files/CSA%20Quickspec%202012.pdf). Generic concrete mixes (cement, SCM, aggregate, water, admixtures) provided by the Technical Committee of Association Béton Québec (Canada) (Recipe compliant with Quebec standards for Work of art concrete, Ministère des transports du Québec - Ministry of Transport, Québec- Canada).The average water consumption (not including batch water) is 65 L/m³ of ready mixed concrete. The average amount of water disposed is 35 L/m³. Water not discarded is recycled back into the process or into other products, and therefore not accounted for in this dataset. Annual production volume of Ready-Mix concrete for North America estimated based on US production, and GDP ratio. Distribution by ready-mix strength class estimated as: - 20 MPa = 20% - 25 MPa = 40% - 30-32 MPa = 15% - 35 MPa = 24% - 50 MPa = 1% (coherent with distribution presented in http://www.ermco.eu/documents/ermco-documents/ermco_-statistics2008_091310.pdf (Table 3);[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets: - concrete production 50MPa, RNA only, GLO, 2006 - 2006 (31ca8bae-81ec-464b-9163-562eb52ff2e9)]

From reception of raw materials at the ready-mix plant gate.

This activity ends before the delivery of concrete at the construction site. The dataset includes the whole manufacturing processes to produce ready-mixed concrete, internal processes (material handling and mixing) and infrastructure. The dataset does not include: - the transport of concrete in a mixing truck. The combustion of 5.74 litres of diesel should be used to take into account the average transportation of 1m³ of concrete.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2395:Manufacture of articles of concrete, cement and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: North American dataset extrapolated from a Quebec (Canada) concrete production. For some exchanges RER-modules have been used as proxy. Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical technology for average North American production. Data quality indicators adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This activity represents a North American concrete production. The generic concrete mix (cement, SCM, aggregate, water, admixtures) provided for Québec (Canada), was used to represent an average North American concrete recipe. Some flows have been kept as in the original (European) ecoinvent dataset (infrastructure, lubricant, rubber, and steel). The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data on process inputs were provided by the Technical Committee of Association Béton Québec (Canada). Water use is from Confidential Life Cycle Inventory Survey of Ready-Mix Concrete Plant (Marceau, VanGeem, and Ranchero 2006a). This survey was distributed to a sample of member-plants of the National Ready Mixed Concrete Association. The sample was chosen so that the plants in the sample are representative of climates of the conterminous United States and plant size in terms of production in cubic yards of ready mixed concrete. The sample consists of 47 plants.
